meanings.definition: The acceptance of two contradictory beliefs or opinions at the same time.
meanings.sent1: She practiced doublethink by believing both it was too late to start and it was never too late to begin.
meanings.sent2: His ability to engage in doublethink allowed him to hold onto conflicting ideas without discomfort.
meanings.sent3: In a moment of doublethink, she convinced herself that eating cake would make her both healthier and happier.
meanings.sent4: The politician's doublethink was like juggling two sharp knives, dangerous but impressive.
meanings.sent5: The concept of doublethink is like trying to walk in two opposite directions at the same time.

meanings.definition: The act of simultaneously accepting two mutually contradictory beliefs as correct.
meanings.sent1: Doublethink was evident in his ability to believe both that he was the best and the worst player on the team.
meanings.sent2: The practice of doublethink allowed him to maintain his conflicting views without inner conflict.
meanings.sent3: She chuckled at the idea of doublethink when she convinced herself that both chocolate was healthy and unhealthy.
meanings.sent4: The company's doublethink was like trying to drive in two opposite directions at once, leading to confusion.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used the concept of doublethink to explain how some people can hold onto contradictory ideas without realizing it.
